body: I see two bugfixes made to this method in 2.0.44 - #18832 and #18898 - but I don't see how those could affect it, could you check what change is causing it?

Looks like test cases of camel2words doesn't cover the case with number as a separate word. In my opinion, the string `Order4OtherPhones` should be converted / splitted to `Order 4 Other Phones`. Hence, with a minor (regex) tweak like this

```php
$label = preg_replace('/(?<=[\p{Ll}0-9])[\p{Lu}0-9]|(?<=[\p{L}0-9])[\p{Lu}0-9](?=\p{Ll})/u', ' \0', $name);
```

should handle the specific case.

The PR to support number(s) in CamelCase string, such as `Order4OtherPhones` to `Order 4 Other Phones` per issue [19204](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/19204)

issue.title: Mutated camel2words broke existing apps

labels.name: status:ready for adoption
labels.description: Feel free to implement this issue.

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
The change introduced in cf1600411cbf71d1c28f81b64430b6319eef5f6e has broke all our REST apps which use `v1/...` as endpoint since we were using camel2words to build url patterns. The same will happen in all other apps which use `Inflector::camel2words` and `Inflector::slug` to generate url or tokens.

A change to a so older function should be done with a parameter or a warning in upgrade notes. I suggest adding a warning to upgrade notes.

### What steps will reproduce the problem?
Having a module named `v1`, create patterns for url from classes namespaces and the use of `Inflector::camel2words` and `Inflector::slug` to convert, i.e; `v1/customerOrders/index` to `v1/customer-orders/index`.

### What is the expected result?
`v1/default/index` returns `DefaultController::actionIndex`
### What do you get instead?
The action is not being resolved by real controller, because the patterns generated are `v-1/customer-orders/index`, but only fails on POST requests.
```
{"name":"Method Not Allowed","message":"Method Not Allowed. This URL can only handle the following request methods: GET, HEAD.","code":0,"status":405,"type":"yii\\web\\MethodNotAllowedHttpException"}
```


### Additional info

| Q                | A
| ---------------- | ---
| Yii version      | 2.0.45
| PHP version      | 8.0
| Operating system | MacOS
